lines.text: [last lines]
[Coates gives Jim his business card]
Got another line 'sides drivin' folks. Glad to be a service to ya anytime.
Goodbye, Mr. Motley
Goodbye, Jim! Goodbye, Elanita!
[Jim reads Coates' business card which advertises his services as a Justice of the Peace - weddings five dollars or one heifer]
Well, I'd like to see it too, please!
[Elanita reads the card and then tries to tear it up]
Now wait a minute. You never can tell, we might meet up with someone who's crazy enough to get married sometime.
Crazy? Well, that's a fine thing to say!
As a matter of fact, I'm beginning to get a little dizzy myself.
Boy, where'd you get that scrumptious hat from?
This sombrero? I buy him. Pay mucho dinero.
[Memphis rattles a pair of dice]
Do you know what these little fellas is for?
Nooo.
You don't? Then come with me. I've been waitin' for you!
[the Sheriff's henchmen have botched Jim's murder]
He's pretty healthy looking for a corpse.
Don Jose made certain promises to his tenants. His will must be read before it is too late!
It's set to be read at four o'clock tomorrow afternoon.
Bueno! Watch yourself every minute. Your death would bring another postponement
Besides being a nuisance to me.
[Miguel, disguised as El Lobo, is severely wounded rescuing Jim from the Sheriff's owlhoots]
Hold on, Mike, I'll get a doctor.
There's no time, amigo. The trail ends for El Lobo.
He can't be far, men! Spread out! Find him! And when you find him, shoot him on sight!
I've been looking all over the place for Pancho. Have you seen him?
Si, Senor. I've been mending the trousers of Senor Jim. He has big holes where the money goes.
[Jim examines Pancho's handiwork]
Very neat, Pancho, but to help me save money, you'll have to sew up both ends of the pockets.
